titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jeanne Hochreiter collection 2002.009
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:47 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection includes documents related to the title history of a property in the Bushwick neighborhood of Brooklyn on a block between Bushwick and Evergreen Avenues and Hancock Street and Jefferson Avenue. Also included are a program of the Bushwick Avenue Baptist Church mentioning the sale of the church, a program for a production of the play Cinderella, and a copy photograph of the Junior Choir of the Bushwick Avenue Methodist Episcopal Church.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Jeanne Hochreiter collection, 2002.009, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
